column4: In scheduling a task to kill Azureus w/ the gnome-scheduler, what would the command be?  Kill azurues wouldn't work, would it?
and any idea why gnome-scheduler keeps saying that I don't have a crontab (besides that I probably don't have a crontab), and/or how to fix it?
'pidof azureus' or 'pgrep azureus' would give the pid
yeah, but it changes each time I start it right?  Not useful for a recurring task
so, make this your command to kill it: kill `pgrep azureus`
check "pgrep azureus" on the command line to make sure it works
good idea...would that work better than killall azureus?
pgrep azureus does not output anything
I'm not sure of the differences between running your killall and the command I suggested, generally they both do the same thing.  Just play on the command line and check a few man pages...
it must be named something else
azureus.  pgrep azurues gives me nothing, and I can't find it in ps -A
it's been giving me problems all night
azureus runs under the process name gij-4.1 ... go figure...
